summary:
Puerto Rico is a group of islands in the Caribbean Sea, east of Florida. It is an unincorporated territory of the United States, with Spanish and English as official languages. The islands were first settled by indigenous people, then claimed by Spain in the 15th century. In 1898, Puerto Rico became a U.S. territory after the Spanish-American War.

Today, Puerto Rico has its own government, with a governor and a legislature. Its economy is strong, with industries like manufacturing and tourism. However, its political status is still debated, as it does not have the same rights as U.S. states.
title: Puerto Rico
